page.title: 05HEALTH CENTRE
page.content: The medical facilties of the area are based at the Holmes Chapel Health Centre which serves people who live winthin 5 miles of it. The building which belongs to the Cheshire Area Health Authority opened in 1973 replacing the doctors' previous surgery in Dr. Picton's garden. The five doctors rent their surgeries and other facilties from the C.A.H.A. They also have to employ eight receptionists and a nurse, as well as providing equipment in excess of that built into their rooms. 10,500 patients are registered with the practice and 44 surgeries are held each week. 15 different clinics are held each week - anti-smoking, blood pressure, speech therapy, etc. These are arranged by C.A.H.A. Recently a physiotherapy unit has been built and equipped by voluntary donations.
